main_definition: A name, title or distinction given to something or someone as a way of identifying it or them.

meanings_and_examples.definition: The act of assigning a specific role or position within an organization or structure.
meanings_and_examples.example: When the new project manager was appointed, she received her designation.

meanings_and_examples.definition: A formal name given to something that distinguishes it from others with similar features.
meanings_and_examples.example: The newly discovered planet has been designated as 'Kepler-1320b' by the astronomical community.

meanings_and_examples.definition: An official title or descriptor used for legal or formal purposes, often to identify a person in a specific role.
meanings_and_examples.example: The lawyer was given the designation of 'Counselor at Law' after passing the bar examination.

meanings_and_examples.definition: The action of designating someone with the authority to make decisions or oversee particular operations in an organization.
meanings_and_examples.example: He received his designation as head of department after years of dedicated service.
